name: Season one of Foundation was deeply polarizing, especially for book readers. The deviations from the canon were significant, and it was hard to see the justification. But season two has been an absolute triumph. The penultimate episode was spectacular, and I cannot wait to experience the finale.

content.html: Season one of Foundation was deeply polarizing, especially for book readers. The deviations from the canon were significant, and it was hard to see the justification. But season two has been an absolute triumph. The penultimate episode was spectacular, and I cannot wait to experience the finale.
content.value: Season one of Foundation was deeply polarizing, especially for book readers. The deviations from the canon were significant, and it was hard to see the justification. But season two has been an absolute triumph. The penultimate episode was spectacular, and I cannot wait to experience the finale.

summary: @jonathan As a book reader, I enjoyed S1 because I always thought that a slavishly faithful adaptation would have been dreadful TV.
